definition: to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against

sentences.english: Sergeant Howard was reduced to the ranks for disregard of orders.
sentences.chinese: 霍華德士官因爲違抗命令而被降爲小兵。

sentences.english: Answer or you may regret your disobedience.
sentences.chinese: 回答，否則你們會爲自己違抗命令後悔的。

sentences.english: But they have been a defiance of the military orders.
sentences.chinese: 但他們已屬於違抗軍令了。

sentences.english: Eating me, you will violate the command of Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 你要吃了我，就違抗了天帝的命令。

sentences.english: Whoever violingesteds the disciplines should be criticized.
sentences.chinese: 誰違抗了紀律，誰就該當遭到月旦。

sentences.english: By eating me, you will violate the command of Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 你要吃了我，就違抗了天帝的命令。

sentences.english: Mindy, how dare you defy me.
Mu Zhixiao of one's proper business, not dare defy, be seized without fighting.
sentences.chinese: 正事母至孝，不敢違抗，束手就擒。

sentences.english: The sergeant was degraded to private for the reason of disobeying order.
sentences.chinese: 這個軍官因爲違抗命令被祕密降級了。

sentences.english: The general was relieved of his command .
sentences.chinese: 這位將軍因爲違抗命令被解除指揮權。

sentences.english: Oberon: Wait, foolish fairy, why do you oppose me so?
sentences.chinese: 等一等，傻精靈，你爲什麼要違抗我？

sentences.english: He was punished for disobeying orders.
sentences.chinese: 他因違抗命令而受到懲罰。

sentences.english: Police denied rumors that the captain was punished for defying orders.
sentences.chinese: 否認了那位長官因爲違抗命令而被懲罰的謠言。

definition: see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
